docs.lead_paragraph: Companies whose pension funds suffered big losses this year will not have to replenish the money quickly under a relief measure that flew through the Senate Thursday and will next go to the president for his signature, The New York Times's Mary Williams Walsh reported.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economist at Princeton. For previous posts in his series on why America pays so much for health care, click here, here and here.

headline.main: Why Does U.S. Health Care Cost So Much? (Part IV: A Primer on Medicare)

docs.abstract: Medicare, the federal health-insurance program for America's elderly, plays a big and controversial role in health care. An economist looks at how the system works, and whether it's sustainable.
